level.heading: DUTIES OF COLLABORATING PHYSICIAN TO ACUPUNCTURIST (ยง 17-4714)

level.text: A collaborating physician shall give written authorization to the acupuncturist to initiate treatment. The authorization shall contain the following:
A summary of the findings of the physician’s examination of the patient; and
Restrictions, if any, to be placed on the course of acupuncture treatment.
A collaborating physician shall be available to the acupuncturist on a daily basis for consultation by a communication device regarding the patient’s condition.
A collaborating physician shall designate a physician to be available for consultation in the temporary absence of the collaborating physician and shall notify the acupuncturist of the following:
The office address of the back-up physician.
For the purposes of this subsection, a collaborating physician shall be considered absent if the collaborating physician:
Travels beyond a thirty (30) mile radius of the District; or
Is unable to practice medicine because of illness, injury, attention to personal needs, or other conflict with the requirements of the practice.
A collaborating physician shall provide written notice to the acupuncturist of the collaborating physician’s intent to terminate the collaboration prior to terminating the collaboration.
